title: Paul Morris (1990s rugby league)
text:
Paul Morris is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1990s. Primarily a er, he played for the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> and was a foundation player for the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a>.
Playing career.
Originally from <a href="Rockhampton%2C%20Queensland">Rockhampton</a>, Morris made his first grade debut for the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> in Round 13 of the <a href="1994%20NSWRL%20season">1994 NSWRL season</a>, starting on the wing and scoring a try in their 10–29 loss to the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a>. He would play three more games for them that season, coming off the bench in all three, before joining the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a>.
A foundation player for the newly formed club, Morris played two games for the Cowboys in <a href="1995%20ARL%20season">1995</a>, coming off the bench in both.
